meanings.definition: A person or company that installs or maintains cables.
meanings.sent1: The cablers arrived early to fix the internet connection.
meanings.sent2: The cablers in our neighborhood are always busy with various projects.
meanings.sent3: The cablers had a cable-cutting contest to see who could work the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The cablers were like wizards, weaving invisible threads to connect the world.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the cablers who saved the day when our cables were all tangled up.

meanings.definition: Plural form of cabler, referring to multiple individuals or companies that work with cables.
meanings.sent1: The cablers were called in to upgrade the cable infrastructure.
meanings.sent2: We hired cablers to ensure our network was running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The cablers threw a party to celebrate their successful cable installations.
meanings.sent4: The cablers worked together like a well-oiled machine, ensuring everything was connected perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The cablers' expertise in handling cables was unmatched in the industry.
